授業目的:
This course is a field study to Finland and Estonia, planned for February 2021. As a group of 8-12 student, we will fly to Finland to meet with students from our partner universities there, as well as to conduct fieldwork. The topic of this course is Labour migration/mobility and rural depopulation in the EU, with focus on Finland and Estonia. We will conduct interviews with government officials and mobile workers (=immigrants from other EU countries) on why such high numbers of people from Eastern Europe (such as Estonia and Latvia) leave their home country, where they work, and how they have integrated into the society of their new country of residence.
We will also look how higher mobility from East to West in the EU, as well as a general tendency to leave the countryside, impacts society, politics and the economy.
This course is highly recommended for students interested in the EU, in Finland, in issues of labour economy and migration, and for all who want to learn more about young people working abroad in the EU.
到達目標: You will learn more about the EU and working conditions there, Finland and Estonia, migration and mobility, and unemployment & wage differences in the EU. You will also experience conducting interviews in English, discuss your ideas and findings with Finnish students, and engage in debates.
授業方法: If the Covid-19 situation allows, the field study will take place in person. If there are travel restrictions, this course will take place online.
